newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent around London close, NYMEX edging down.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent around London close, NYMEX edging down.

text.p: May Brent crude futures were widely quoted either side of the London close around midday in Asia on Monday, with the market poised for a key test of sentiment.
May Brent settled in London at $19.99, one cent under key support at $20.00. May was untraded on SIMEX, but quoted at $19.75/$20.10 per barrel.
June, which settled at two cents contango against May, was quoted at $19.65/$20.10.
Brokers said the market could face a further test of the support, especially as there was only one featured broker buying the market on Friday between the intraday low of $19.96 and $20.00.
"This short-term move down is more related to cash weakness. People are selling the futures to test where the stops are," one broker said.
NYMEX May crude was last traded at $21.45 -- the intraday low -- and down six cents from New York on Friday, moving to test New York's intraday low of $21.43.
